Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I extended the type of vouts that exist. before we had p2pk, p2pkh and p2sh. basically with very few exceptions all scriptPubKey were one of those three types

Content: now there is a cryptoconditions type of vout

Content: but additionally, each CC output has an evalcode

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it is easy to have it go from normal coin to CC utxo and back

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means all chains with CC enabled will be able to use all of the CC contracts

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
EVAL codes in eval.h are the CC contract types i believe.
"`rewards contract`" ID is 0xe5, `faucet contract` is 0xe4.

The goal is to have building blocks of smart contracts.
It's important to ignore for 1 moment that assets/tokens exist and can be exchanged.  This is a huge smart contract.

Imagine faucet was the first contract made.
It includes `CCinclude.h` which has all the core komodo stuff (wallet, signing, etc.) and eval.h so that somewhere i can spit out the ID of the contract type it is.

The smart contract "library" or "catalogue" is available to all of komodo.  You pick what you need to use for your use of blockchain.

That's how i'm reading it.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: If you need something different, you pick the "smart contract of closest fit" and make your changes.  If you want, you PR it upstream back to komodo and it is included in the komodo "catalogue of smart contracts"

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: If you wanted to write contracts in go....as long as the data structures are the same, you're only encoding/decoding bytes of signed transactions - so as long as go can use the cpp libs - yeah why not!?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
@jl777c can you explain what exactly the purpose of these addresses are? 
https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/da8b0b333653ce2539fd61c3d1fc6f27a9944fe2/src/cc/CCcustom.cpp#L45

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I just imported RFYE2yL3KknWdHK6uNhvWacYsCUtwzjY3u on ATEST and spent the .0001 that was in it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: going to try the other addresses

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/da8b0b333653ce2539fd61c3d1fc6f27a9944fe2/src/cc/CCcustom.cpp#L67
this one isn't the correct privkey for that commented address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can only spend the normal funds in those addresses, CC outputs are protected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC addresses map the CC scriptPubKey to an address, not the pubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the purpose of the addresses are to have special addresses that all nodes have the privkey for and are able to sign the CC transaction to released otherwise locked funds

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and what's the purpose of sending coins to them?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: depends on the CC contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the faucet contract, the purpose is to have funds for the faucet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the assets contract, the purpose is to create colored coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the rewards contract, the purpose is to have funds for the rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: contracts usually needs to have funds to operate.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Should the colored coins be going to RGKRjeTBw4LYFotSDLT6RWzMHbhXri6BG6 instead of RFYE2yL3KknWdHK6uNhvWacYsCUtwzjY3u?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: The faucetfund coins go to the non-commented address

Author: Alright#0419
Content: whereas the tokens go to the commented address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, the commented address is the normal address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what do you mean tokens goes to commented address?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tokens go to RGKRjeTBw4LYFotSDLT6RWzMHbhXri6BG6

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I just mean that the tokencreate tx has vouts going to the commented address

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and no vouts going to the non-commented address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes because when you create tokens you dont send them to the contract you send them to yourself

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
from assets.cpp:
 create
 vin.0: normal input
 vout.0: issuance assetoshis to CC
 vout.1: tag sent to AssetsCCaddress
 vout.2: normal output for change (if any)
 vout.n-1: opreturn [EVAL_ASSETS] ['c'] [origpubkey] "<assetname>" "<description>"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: comment is wrong, should be the normal address for vout1

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: locking is needed for doing trades

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you would lock assets (or coins) in the AssetsCCaddress when you make a bid or ask

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ok understood, that address is for coins you set a condition for them able to be spent

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what I don't understand is why tokencreate sends coins to an address that everyone has a privkey for and can spend them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is just 0.0001 for a tag to easily get a list of all creates

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where it wouldnt be saturated with a bunch of other tx

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ah ok that makes sense

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i figure 0.0001 is no big deal cost wise

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the coins sent to the CC address are all in effect locked as you need to follow the contract rules to be able to spend them

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
Just a general guidance on reporting issues to jl777:
```
a) the specific chain parameters so I can connect to it
b) the EXACT rpc call and parameters you used
c) the most important! the raw tx generated
d) clear description of why you think it is a bug. for now you need to look at the raw tx details to make sure all vins are valid, signed and all vouts are sane.
e) do not post things like "i tried X and it didnt work" as that does not help at all at this stage. These are raw transaction level things and until everything works, things wont work at the higher level.
```
